description: In this 300-level topics course, students will examine the history of golden age American musical theater (1943-1965) within the context of ethnic identity, power, privilege, and inequality in the United States. Through readings, textual analysis, peer discussions, performance, and written assessments, students will gain insight into how identity and difference informed the making of musical theater both as a practice and an art form in the United States. Prerequisite: THEAT 180, THEAT 271, or MUSIC 141, or permission of instructor. RACE credit offered.
shortname: Top: Golden Age of Am Musical Theat
